Understanding the science of speech-language pathology is essential to effective practice and clinical decision-making. Most SLPs don’t have the time to navigate paywalls and comb through the hundreds of articles published across dozens of academic journals each and every month. With our monthly reviews and smart database, you can jump right to the clinically-relevant research you need, then get right back to focusing on your clients. 3000+ clinical research reviews 3000+ clinical research reviews We have evidence for every SLP. Members get access to our database of thousands of research reviews, drawn from hundreds of journals in and outside our field and covering the full SLP scope of practice. It’ll be your new go-to for EBP. Experts in your pocket Experts in your pocket You need to be able to trust what you read. Our staff of 50+ top clinicians and scientists work together to produce the highest-quality content possible, in consultation with article authors and outside experts. Learn more about how we ensure accuracy. CEUs, 5 minutes at a time CEUs, 5 minutes at a time Hour-long courses aren’t always compatible with busy clinical practice. Here, you accrue small chunks of credit as you read, which we track and report for you monthly. Say goodbye to the year-end scramble for hours! Intuitive database, plus audio Intuitive database, plus audio Our site is built for the way SLPs think, so it’s fast and efficient to find exactly what you need. Bookmarks and printables keep you organized, and the flexible print and audio features let you learn how you like, wherever you are. Erin McQuivey, MS, CCC-SLP Outpatient Pediatric SLP TISLP is the first place I go when I encounter something in my clinical practice that I want to know more about. The search features make it fast and easy to navigate. The variety of formats give me what I want, how I want it. I find it very intuitive. It’s like it knows how an SLP thinks! Becky, MS, CCC-SLP Inpatient Rehab Hospital The Informed SLP makes it so easy and enjoyable to stay up to date with the latest research. I love how the article summaries are broken down into accessible terms and include takeaways that I can immediately use in my practice. So very grateful for this resource! Briana R, MS, CCC-SLP Private Practice SLP TISLP has been an amazing way for me to continue to be informed on current research and best practices, while maintaining my busy SLP schedule. As the lead of the speech department at a private practice, I can feel confident that I am helping my own clients and the clients of the SLPs that I supervise have the best clinical outcomes. Amanda Mahler, MA, CCC-SLP Midland County ESA As a busy, traveling special ed SLP, time for CE and learning about new best practices in our field is hard to come by. TISLP is a lifesaver. I listen to the reviews while driving, and answer a quick question for CE credit when I arrive at my next therapy location. I am implementing new EBP with every student– without weekend journal reading! Hannah, MA, CCC-SLP Hinds County Schools It is a reminder to do a monthly check-in about why I am doing what I am doing.  As I listen to reviews, I think through my caseload and what I need to modify, scrap, or re-energize.  Sometimes the reviews are exactly what I needed and sometimes it inspires me to dig deeper about a new question. Hailey Pedersen, MS, CCC-SLP Early Childhood SLP It makes the research easily and quickly digestible. I feel like I’m more able to practice at the top of the license now that I’m staying current on the research. EBP was always something that was intimidating and I never knew how to do it, especially as a school SLP. Now I have access to it and it feels great! Melissa, MS, CCC-SLP Outpatient Pediatric SLP I feel so much more confident explaining to parents and colleagues why I’m doing what I’m doing. I have research to back up my treatment and have clear examples and ways to phrase explanations. I love saving posts where I learned something new (or what I could be doing better!) and referencing them over and over again. Samantha DiNello, MA, CCC-SLP Early Intervention SLP The mission of The Informed SLP is to connect clinicians and scientists with each other’s work. And while the primary responsibility of knowledge brokers is to translate and share information accurately for the people who need it, we believe that a secondary responsibility of our company is to leave our field better than we found it. Ultimately, our presence in the SLP community means we also have a responsibility to it. In recognition of this, we consistently and wholeheartedly commit to generosity, reciprocity, and respect for the SLPs, clients, and scientists we serve.
